abstract: Bahamas has enacted stringent immigration rules requiring everyone to hold passport and sending wave of fear through Haitian immigrant community; rights advocates say that law unfairly targets people of Haitian descent, who are most likely to have immigrated illegally to Bahamas due to poverty at home.
lead_paragraph: A fiercely debated new immigration policy in the Bahamas requires everyone to hold a passport, a rule that human rights groups say unfairly targets people of Haitian descent.
snippet: A fiercely debated new immigration policy in the Bahamas requires everyone to hold a passport, a rule that human rights groups say unfairly targets people of Haitian descent.

headline.main: Immigration Rules in Bahamas Sweep Up Haitians
headline.print_headline: Haitians Are Swept Up as Bahamas Tightens Immigration Rules
